introduction: ^You finally finish the 7-day trek through the woods to find yourself in front of the forgotten, dilapidated village. This village has been lost to time by the rest of the world; the people don't seem interested in interacting with the rest of the world. There seems to be nothing left of the simple life and joy that you were told existed here. The abominations have been too regular as of late it seems.
describe_villagers: ^The few villagers that are left appear to be living in a life of squalor.
^Everyone ignores your gaze as you attempt to find the person that had asked you here in the first place.
describe_villagers_2: ^As you get to the town hall, you see someone. Not quite human, yet not too different either...
info_from_mother: ^You go to approach the stranger, but there is a sudden tight grip on your arm. A haggard woman has rushed over to you, and she yanks you into the crumbling yet imposing town hall.
info_from_mother_2: ^"You don't want to stay out in the town for too long, we can't have the person who's supposed to be finding my daughter getting snatched by a variant, can we?"
^Choose your next words wisely to gain her trust and valuable clues.

c-1: ^"I'm here to help you. Tell me about your daughter."

info_from_mother_wrong: ^The witness doesn't trust you, try again.

c-0: ^"I'm here to help you. Tell me about Lena."

info_from_mother_right: ^"You don't want to stay around those VARIANTS for long. For all we know, that one you were gawking at took my Lena away from me."
info_from_mother_3: ^"Those kinds are sneaky. It's far too easy for them to have stolen her away from me in the night. If it was up to us, they would have been driven out of here long ago."
mother_conclusion: ^You get the sense that there is a lot of hostility in this town.

b: ^You don't know if you can trust that this Variant had anything to do with the missing girl, but it's the only lead you have for now.
^"Actually, I'm not sure I should be speaking to you..."
^The woman hasn't been very forthcoming with you. Restart the conversation?

mutant_introduction: ^You go back outside. The village is even more deserted than when you arrived.

^The VARIANT is still standing where you left them, eyes gazing at nothing in particular. With a vacant expression like that, surely they can't be intelligent enough to be involved in the kidnapping...can they?
mutant_dialogue: ^"Huh. If you're working for the townspeople, no."
variant_info_right: ^"I have no judgements about this place, I barely know anyone. Can I trust you?"

^"You'd be the first. The town has been trying to get rid of us forever, but this is our home too so we're just doing what we can to survive. That girl and her witch friends didn't like us much either."
variant_info_wrong: ^"The townspeople seem to think you have something to do with the missing girl."
^"Look at you, coming in all guns blazing. You know nothing about this place."
^The Variant doesn't trust you. Try again.

c-1: ^"The townspeople are terrified of you, they must have a good reason to be."
^"They're just afraid of what they don't understand. Like you."

variant_info_2: ^"A cult, more like. They're the ones stealing children."
variant_info_2A: ^"Whatever, it's just a rumour. Go ask them about it - they live in the swamp like real savages. At least I have a proper house."
variant_conclusion: ^All these people hating each other and still living so close together. Was Lena really taken, or did she leave of her own accord?

b: ^Sounds like the witches at the edge of town could have seen her recently.
^This Variant doesn't want to talk to you anymore.
^You haven't found any clues. Restart the conversation?

witch_introduction: ^As you get to the edge of town, the buildings start to fade away and you're left surrounded by dilapidated huts. The swamp is enshrouded by an otherwordly fog that clings to the ground and hangs in the air, casting a perpetual twilight. The trees are twisted and gnarled, their branches reaching out like skeletal fingers and the air is thick with the scent of damp earth and decaying vegetation.
swamp_description: ^From the few huts, you spot several which seem to have been broken into, left in a state of disarray.
oracle_cabin: ^The workshop is stood above a particularly marshy area, connected to a patch of dry land by a rickety wooden bridge. Wind chimes made from bones and shells hang from the eaves, creating a haunting melody.
^You should come back here later to investigate.
alchemist_workshop: ^A ramshackle building created by what seems like salvaged wood and metal, it has several chimneys protruding from it's roof emitting shining and strange coloured smoke. You can peer just inside the window and notice complex mechs and machine dominate the space, with shelves of exotic ingredients lining the walls.
^You should come back here later to investigate.
summoners_lair: ^You can see that the hut is made from a much darker wood than any of the other houses, with bones scattered throughout. Throughout the structure, there are charms and protections scratched into the building, practically being cramped in to every possible surface.
^You should come back here later to investigate.
witch_dialogue: ^Finally, in the middle of the swamp you see the Elder's hut standing. It is made from ancient, twisted trees and adorned with powerful wards and charms that you can sense, even from here. Inside, shelves have been overturned, books and scrolls scattered across the floor. The atmosphere is tense and foreboding, as if the very swamp itself holds its breath, waiting for what will happen next.
^As you begin to move closer towards the Elder's hut, you see them emerge and start towards you.

c-0: ^"Your hut appears to have seen better days."
c-1: ^"Tell me what you know about the missing girl."

witch_info_right1: ^"You just can't get the staff nowadays. Doesn't help that kids just wander around here helping themselves to our things."

c-0: ^"Would one of those kids be Lena, the missing girl?"

witch_info_wrong1: ^"Who are you? Speak to me with such disrespect again and you will not be welcome here."
^The Elder doesn't trust you. Try again.

c-0: ^"Who are you to demand respect? I am trying to help this place."
c-1: ^"I'm sorry if I caused offence. Who caused all this mess?"

witch_info2: ^"She was always snooping where she shouldn't be, and my book went missing the same night she disappeared. But I never thought she'd have the audacity to enter my hut, let alone steal from me."

c-1: ^"I've never been to a place so haunted by magic. Could the book be dangerous?"
^"I've never been to a place so haunted by magic. Could the book be dangerous?"

b: ^"You and your questions aren't welcome. You must leave now."
^"Who are you? Speak to me with such disrespect again and you will not be welcome here."
^The Elder doesn't trust you. Try again.

witch_info_right2: ^"It is a very powerful grimoire. It contains spells that can easily overwhelm someone who doesn't understand their potency."
witch_info_right2B: ^"There's a powerful enchantment to summon a protector of the village that she could use to drive out the variants. But there is a cost and she couldn't do it alone..."
witch_info_right2C: ^"I'm not sure who, but I might know where."

b: ^"There's a grove, not far from here. She used to play there, by the old willow tree. It's a place where the veil between worlds is thin."
^You haven't found any clues. Restart the conversation?

villager_introduction: ^The swamp seemed even more foreboding as you and the Elder make your way throught he mist, guided by a small light spell that she conjured. The trees loom overhead. Suddenly, you spot a the faint outline of a villager ahead, and a lantern softly glowing.

c-0: ^"Have you seen a young girl come by here in the last few days?"

villager_dialogue: ^"I saw her pass by with a stranger earlier."

c-1: ^"It's alright, I'll protect you. Against this outsider as well."

villager_info_wrong1: ^"Look, I don't know you. If that kid's in danger, you could be it."
^The villager doesn't trust you. Try again.

c-0: ^"You're right to be mistrustful. You'll have to decide if you think me or that stranger is the bigger threat to Lena, but time is not on our side."
c-1: ^"You people are infuriating! I don't know how to get you to trust me, but you have to if we want to have any chance of finding Lena."

c-0: ^"I'm doing this as a favour for Lena's mother because she has some information I need. If I harm anyone, I'm not getting that info."
c-1: ^"I don't know how to get you to trust me, but you have to if we want to have any chance of finding Lena. We don't have time for this!"

villager_info_right1: ^"It was a man, dressed in dark robes and whispering in her ear. He appeared out of nowhere and I swear his eyes were glowing..."
villager_info_wrong2: ^"Forget it, you could be one of them for all I know."

c-0: ^"They have shown no ill intent so far. I cannot speak for their intelligence, though."
c-1: ^"I have done nothing to warrant such suspicion. The girl is in danger - her mother asked me to help!"

c-0: ^"They have shown no ill intent so far. I cannot speak for their intelligence, though."
c-1: ^"I have done nothing to warrant such suspicion. The girl is in danger - her mother asked me to help!"

villager_info_right2: ^"Well honestly, I'm glad you came. I tried to follow them but the mist has become so thick I lost them and then I lost myself."
villager_info_right3: ^"This is the path to the Altar. The ancient power surrounding it may be allowing them to hide within the mist..."

b: ^You haven't found any clues. Restart the conversation?

suspect_introduction: ^The villager leads you through a narrow, winding path deeper into the swamp. The air grows cooler and an unnatural silence falls over the surroundings. After several tense minutes, you arrive at the grove. Through the trees, you can make out the old Altar and in the flickering light of several candles, Lena and the mysterious man stand.

c-0: ^The robed man falls to his knees as if you have physically exhausted him, though the air still crackles with magical energy - the ritual is not yet broken.
^You're confident that he will tell the TRUTH.
c-1: ^Though the air still crackles with magical energy, you are exhausted and cannot continue. You can't get a read on this man and your head is swimming with uncertainty, while the ritual is not yet broken.

suspect_conclusion1: ^"Please, don't harm me. The girl wanted to come here."
suspect_conclusion2: ^"She won't speak to you. The enchantment prevents it and I've tried breaking it already."
suspect_conclusion3: ^"She asked me to help with the spell, but I swear I didn't know what it did."
suspect_conclusionA: ^"Don't harm me, please. I was just trying to help the girl."
suspect_conclusionB: ^"She won't speak to you. The enchantment prevents it and I've tried breaking it already."
suspect_conclusionC: ^"I can't put an end to this, and neither can the girl."
^"If you're looking for someone to blame, you might want to look at the wicked creature standing next to you."
final_conclusion: ^The Elder begins to chant a warbling incantation, attempting to break the spell.
final_conclusion1: ^The Elder's chant reaches a crescendo and a brilliant light burst from her staff, enveloping the altar and the stranger. The ritual shatters.
final_conclusion2: ^Lena drops the grimoire, frozen as she realises in horror where she is. She appears to finally be free from whatever spell she was under.
final_conclusion_allclues: ^Suddenly, the ground beneath you turns over itself, yielding to your boots. Everyone finds themselves sinking rapidly, though Lena and the villager are smaller and lighter, and manage to start sprinting back through the trees.
final_conclusion_allclues1: ^The Elder and the Priest are being pulled under by the heaviness of their robes; You only have time to help one of them.
^Quickly, review your evidence and make a decision about who to reach for!

c-0: ^You barely know the Priest, and there's no denying the fact that he was the one who brought Lena here. You grab the Elder's hand.
c-1: ^Whether he knew what he was doing or not, the Priest didn't deserve to die here. The Elder could probably save herself with magic but he seemed completely helpless. You grab the Priest's hand.

ending: ^You sprint away as best you can with the mulch sucking on your boots and don't look back.
^You're not sure how much you've helped the town here, but at least Lena is safe and you can return to her mother for the information about your missing partner.
clue_variant: ^The townspeople, including Lena, really doesn't like Variants. Although the one you met seemed pretty harmless. They told you that Lena had been friends with the "witches", also known as "Elders".
clue_elder: ^The Elder told you that Lena stole the spell book, but wouldn't have known enough about it to use it alone.
clue_villager: ^The villager you met in the swamp saw the priest whispering to Lena as they headed towards the Altar, but couldn't hear what he was saying.
clue_book: ^The spell book belongs to the Elder. Lena was holding it when you found her at the Altar.
clue_altar: ^The Altar is a place of strong magical power. It might even have sentience of its own. The Elder seems to have some knowledge about it.
clue_swamp: ^The swamp contains the Altar as well as the Elders' village.
clue_priest: ^The priest told you he didn't know what the spell did, and that his intention was just to help Lena. You believe he is telling the truth.
